bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, February 6, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Hamer for locating maps of Camp Lazear and Camp Columbia.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, February 6, 1942
div1.opener:
Y F.
February 6, 1942
Mr. P. M. Hamer
Director of Reference Service
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Hamer:
div1.p:
I appreciate greatly the trouble that you
must have taken to try to find the various maps of Camp
Lazear and Camp Columbia which I have been trying to
find. I am sorry indeed that they are not in the Division
of Maps and Charts.

I am awaiting with pleasure the arrival
of the microfilm and photostats of the rather considerable
material which I selected personally in the National
Archives.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
